name: Hotel Casa do Amarelindo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't think there's much to add to all the praise other traveler's have provided, but I think that when you have an exceptional experience at a hotel, they deserve proper thanks.
reviews.title: #1 For a Reason

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent only two nights here in May (due to a missed flight in Miami... followed by lost luggage). Suffice to say, things did not start off great, but the staff were so immensely helpful and accomodating that we were able to just enjoy being in Salvador. They helped us recover our luggage from the airline, offered us great recommendations for local food, and overall were some of the most friendly and hospitable people we've come across in all of our travels.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended and well worth the price...
Welcoming hotel in beautiful place
reviews.text: As for the hotel itself, it is quite lovely, with large rooms, comfortable beds, and a beautiful little roof deck for sunsets. It is right in the heart of the old town, which is really a wonderful little area to stroll around. Casa do Amarelindo's #1 ranking is well deserved, and their staff should all be proud of the type of operation they run.
My husband and I returned from 4 days/3 nights in Salvador. This hotel was by far the highlight of our trip to the area. The hotel was clean, safe, in a good location and the staff was exceptional.
reviews.title: Cannot praise it enough

reviews.text: We started our journey into Salvador with some bad luck with flights and ended up arriving many hours late and after midnight. This would have left us a little grumpy and sleepy, but the hospitality and efforts of the owners made a real difference. We stayed on two separate occasions at the hotel, and both times were met personally by one of the owners which made us feel valued and welcome. Especially good was the helpful information on Salvador, the free welcome drink voucher, and the news that we could have breakfast whenever we wanted the next day.
reviews.title: Great hotel except for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at this top-class hotel in July and beyond any doubt it was the best choice we could have made. It was just what we imagined it would be following the many stunning recommendations and it remains a highlight of our holiday in Brazil.
reviews.title: The Best of Brazil!

reviews.text: Great breakfast, amazing room with a HUGE bed and ther best shower possible, this place ticked all the boxes. For me this is : hot water for a shave, comfortable bed, a quiet night's sleep and central location. Anything more is a bonus and the Amerelindo provides plenty more. The owners were on holiday when we were there but you would not notice; everything worked well as they have a well-trained staff who know the business and can deal with customer care without any problems. From the moment we set foot into that beautiful establishment down to helping us with luggage to the taxi rank just 50 meters away on the morning of our departure, they thought of everything.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a dicey neighborhood

reviews.text: We really appreciated being in the historic centre of Salvador, Pelourhino. This vibrant and authentic neighbourhood beats the socks off any other part of this city. Why anyone would choose some chain hotel down on the coast is quite beyond me. If travel is about new experiences then Pelourinho has to be the place to stay - don't even think about the predictable tourist, coach party hotels down on the front. Sure, at night the neighbouirhood does feel edgy, but there is no need to wander too far and the place really is safe. It has a genuine buzz which goes along with some run down residences. Do not expect Disney chic here, it can appear a bit raw but this is its appeal (I would not call it charm). I can see what the government is trying to do with this area and it hope that it works without the place becoming a disinfected, gentrified tourist trap with MacDonalds and Starbucks. Glad to say, none of this exists in Pelourhino. Please stay here before the world discovers it!
reviews.title: Just book it: you will only know when you go!

reviews.text: My only small criticism is the lack of a customer computer ( I know, I ought to get myself an ipad) as a result, I went to a nearby internet cafe which my aol server decided was suspicious and blocked my account until I returned home to France. Not the hotel's fault of course, but I doubt my server would have thought a hotel address was suspicious.
reviews.title: Excellent hôtel

reviews.text: Tip: take the B$100 airport transfer to the hotel. It is cheaper than the taxi (B$115) and is reliable. Try the hotel restaurant for an evening meal and enjoy the fab breakfast.
reviews.title: Really a Boutique Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the complimentary caipiranhas on arrival to the brilliant sunsets viewed from the roof deck to the mouth-watering meals served by the restaurant: this hotel is truly superb. The room we had was large, clean, and quiet-- with an especially comfortable bed and a spectacular shower. Sights arfe close by-- and the beaches are only a short taxi ride away. The English-speaking staff were all friendly and helpful. And don't miss the Bale Folclorico da Bahia!
reviews.title: A truly wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to get a room in Hotel Casa Do Amarelindo during the carnival.
reviews.title: Amazing stay in Salvador
Phenomenal service, food, and hospitality, with a gigantic bed to boot
reviews.text: Gilles and Didier had obviously thought of every tiny detail in the hotel. From the overall design of the rooms and other spaces, to the yogurt served at breakfast- everything was excellent. The standard room is huge and clean, with spacious bathroom, big and dreamy bed, safe, cables flat screen TV and DVD, and WiFi all over the place. Breakfast alone is a good enough reason to stay at the Amarelindo hotel. Fresh juices, coffee, best hot chocolate ever, toasts, brioche, different kind of everything, pastries- and all in the best quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The terrace and the beautiful refreshing pool has amazing views, and there is an equipped gym at the hotel as well. Location- in the heart of Pelourinho, easy access to everywhere, at the beautiful and safe historical part of Salvador.
reviews.title: An adorable gem of a place.

reviews.text: And above all, the most welcoming staff, always with a smile, helping out (English speaking staff) with everything we needed, generous and professional.
reviews.title: Top of the line in every respect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spend 3 nights in Salvador in March 2012. Casa do Amerelindo is a beautifully designed hotel where it is obviously that much attention was paid to design and aesthetics. From the art work to the bed linens everything was superb. Our room was very nice with a lovely Terrance and a great shower in the bathroom. Although Salvador has quite a bohemian feel to it, once we stepped foot in the hotel we were able to enjoy all modern amenities. Two of our favorite things were the wonderful breakfast that we looked forward to eating every morning and the pool, although a bit small, that we enjoyed on one hot evening.
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.text: The staff spoke English and was generally helpful, but most of the employees except two guys had a mild to neutral attitude - we were just hoping that for the high price that we paid for the room that the staff and the owner would have been a tad more " receiving" and warm. Nonetheless, we would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: great and comfortable stay

reviews.text: Outstanding service from all staff and plenty of attention to detail from owners, who run this pousada like clockwork. Thoughtfully designed rooms, nice common areas, complete breakfast. Recommended.
reviews.title: Stay here in Salvador if you can afford it

reviews.text: the hotel is very nice and you find it in the neighbourhood Pelourinho in the historic city centre of Salvador in a street where no cars are allowed to drive, which is quite nice
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel in the best location in town

reviews.text: Recently spent a couple of nights at Casa do Amarelindo in Salvador on way to Morro de Sao Paulo. Perfectly situated at the top of a stone street in the heart of Pelourinho, this boutique hotel has really more of a bed and breakfast feel made so by the two French gentlemen that own and manage the hotel. They and their local staff could not have been more helpful in making our stay comfortable and recommending various sites to visit, places to eat, areas to avoid, etc. The owners have recently completed a very high quality, stylish renovation of the building. The rooms are comfortable, spacious, and nicely appointed. The restaurant and bar service was friendly, attentive, and top-notch and the food quality was excellent. The elaborate, served any time and place (in restaurant, in room, or pool-side) breakfast is exceptional. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Close to perfect
Great Place
reviews.text: Casa do Amarelindo was very special. Great location, friendly staff, comfortable rooms and most amenities. Very charming with alot of attention to detail. The owners are very visible and the hotel is definitely a work of love. Restaurant was good, a couple of bars, good travel desk and great service. Would go back there just for the hotel.

description: Hotel de charme in a fully restored XIXth colonial house in the very heart of Pelourinho, facing All Saints’ Bay. Sunny swimming pool and panoramic roof-terrace. 10 high standard rooms with luxury bedding, 1 gastronomic restaurant, 2 bars, 1 solarium, 1 fitness. All rooms with full sound insulation, air conditioning, ceiling fan, free broad-band internet access, free electronic safe, LCD TV, DVD, frigo-bar. Most rooms with private terrace or balcony with bay or city view. Free WiFi at restaurant, lobby and garden-bar.
